title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians

content.rendered:
What are Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians?

Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians take samples and conduct tests in order to analyze substances like body fluids and tissue.

Where do Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians work?

  • Hospitals
  • Diagnostic labs
  • Doctors’ offices

How much do Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Biology majors
  • Chemistry majors
  • Biochemistry majors
Search Medical and Clinical Laboratory jobs

Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions
  • Knowledge of testing methods
  • Strong communication skills

What are some common questions about Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologists and Technicians?

Q: How do I become a medical or clinical laboratory technologist?

A: Most employers are looking for individuals who have at least an associates degree and have passed an accredited certification exam.
